source_sentence: 大方等大集經賢護分卷第一
translation: *Mahāmegha-sūtra, Part I

source_sentence: 隋天竺三藏闍那崛多譯
translation: Translated by the Tripiṭaka of India, translated by Jñānagupta

source_sentence: 思惟品第一
translation: The First Chapter of Meditation

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在王舍城迦蘭陀竹園精舍，與大比丘眾五百人俱，皆是阿羅漢——諸漏已盡，
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, when the Buddha was staying at the monastery of Kalandaka’s Bamboo Grove Monastery in Rājagaha, accompanied by five hundred bhikṣus, all arhats who had completely extinguished their defilements.

source_sentence: 無復煩惱，咸得自在；
translation: They no longer have afflictions and attain mastery over all.

source_sentence: 心善解脫、慧善解脫，調伏一切猶如大龍；
translation: Their minds are well liberated, and their intellects well liberated; they tame all like a great dragon.

source_sentence: 所作已辦、眾行具備，棄捨重擔不受後生；
translation: Their deeds are accomplished, their practices are carried out, and they abandon heavy burdens and not undergo rebirth in the afterlife.

source_sentence: 行於平等獲真己利，安住正教得到彼岸——唯除長老阿難一人。
translation: He practices equality to obtain true self-benefit and abides in the right teaching to attain the other shore - except for the elder Ānanda alone.

source_sentence: 爾時，復有五百諸比丘，於晨朝時各從住處詣世尊所，恭敬合掌，頂禮佛足，
translation: At that time another five hundred bhikṣus came to the World-honored One from their respective residences in the morning and, venerating him by joining their palms, bowed at his feet.

source_sentence: 退坐一面。
translation: He withdrew and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者舍利弗、尊者大目連在舍衛城夏安居已，亦與五百諸比丘俱，
translation: At that time, when Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana had completed their summer retreat at Sāvatthī, they were also accompanied by five hundred monks:

source_sentence: 次第遊行城邑聚落至王舍城，入迦蘭陀竹園精舍詣世尊所。
translation: In order, he traveled to the city of Rājagṛha and entered the Kalandaka's Bamboo Grove monastery in Kālôdayin to visit the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 到已，恭敬頂禮佛足，退坐一面。
translation: Having arrived there, they bowed their heads at the Buddha’s feet and withdrew to sit at one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊以神通力放大威光，令彼諸國城邑聚落一切所有諸比丘眾咸各來詣王舍大城，
translation: At that time the World-honored One emanated a great ray of light from his supernormal powers, causing all the monks in those cities and villages to come to the great city of Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 入迦蘭陀竹園精舍至世尊所，恭敬合掌，頂禮佛足，退坐一面。
translation: He entered the monastery of Kalandaka’s Bamboo Grove and came to the place where the World-honored One was. Respectfully joining his palms, he bowed his head at the Buddha’s feet and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，迦蘭陀竹園精舍有百千數諸比丘等，承佛威光皆已雲集至世尊所，
translation: At the time, there were hundreds of thousands of monks from the monastery in the Kalandaka’s Bamboo Grove. Having received the Buddha’s authoritative light, they all gathered together like clouds and came to the place where the World-honored One was.

source_sentence: 恭敬合掌，頂禮佛足，退坐一面。
translation: He joined his palms in respect, bowed his head at the Buddha’s feet, withdrew, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，復有彼摩訶波闍波提比丘尼——亦承世尊威神力故——亦與二萬比丘尼俱，
translation: At the time, there were also those mahāprajāpatī bhikṣus and nuns-also by the power of the Bhagavān-and 20,000 other bhikṣus and nuns.

source_sentence: 悉皆大集，入迦蘭陀竹園精舍詣世尊所，恭敬合掌，頂禮佛足，退坐一面。
translation: They all gathered together in great assembly and entered the monastery at Kalandaka’s Bamboo Grove to visit the World-honored One. Respectfully joining their palms, they bowed their heads at the Buddha’s feet and withdrew to sit at one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，王舍大城有優婆塞名曰賢護，為眾上首，亦與五百優婆塞俱——受持五戒、具足威儀，
translation: At the time, there was a layman named Bhadrapāla in the great city of Rājagṛha. He was the leader of the assembly and also accompanied by five hundred laymen who observed the five precepts and were endowed with deportment.

source_sentence: 是大菩薩，久已住於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提行；
translation: This great enlightening being had long been abiding in the practice of unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 本願力故，常隨世尊、樂聞正法；
translation: Because of the power of their original vow, they always follow the World-honored One and delight in hearing the true teaching.

source_sentence: 恒懃精進，為滿一切助道法故——於朝旦時，承佛威神，從本住處入迦蘭陀竹園精舍至世尊所，
translation: He was always earnest and diligent, striving to fulfill all the aids to enlightenment. At dawn he entered the monastery of Kalandaka’s Bamboo Grove from his original dwelling place into the presence of the World-honored One.

source_sentence: 恭敬合掌，頂禮佛足，退坐一面。
translation: He joined his palms in respect, bowed his head at the Buddha’s feet, withdrew, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，毘耶離大城有一離車子名曰寶生，為眾上首，亦與二萬八千諸離車俱，
translation: At that time in the great city of Vaiśālī there was a Licchavi youth named Ratnākara, the leader of the assembly, accompanied by twenty-eight thousand Licchavis.

source_sentence: 於晨朝時，承佛神力，皆自彼城發，來入此迦蘭陀園至如來所，恭敬合掌，
translation: In the early morning, by the power of the Buddha’s supernatural manifestation, they all departed from that city and came to this Kālānda Park. They approached the Tathāgata with joined palms in reverence.

source_sentence: 頂禮佛足，退坐一面。
translation: He bowed his head at the Buddha’s feet, withdrew, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，瞻婆城有一長者子名曰星藏，為眾上首，亦與二萬八千長者子俱，
translation: At that time in the city of Campā there was an elderly man named Śrīgarbha, the leader of the assembly. He was also accompanied by twenty-eight thousand elderly men.

source_sentence: 於晨朝時，承佛神力，自瞻婆城發，來入此迦蘭陀園至世尊所，恭敬合掌，
translation: In the early morning, by the power of the Buddha’s supernatural manifestation, they came from the city of Campā and entered this Kālānda Park. They approached the World-honored One with joined palms in reverence.

source_sentence: 頂禮佛足，退坐一面。
translation: He bowed his head at the Buddha’s feet, withdrew, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，復有一摩那婆(隋言淨持，亦云少年，亦云仁童子等)名那羅達多，
translation: At that time there was another manabha (known as Jīvaka in the Sui, also known as youth and Rentongzi) named Nāradatta.

source_sentence: 為眾上首，亦與二萬八千人俱，於晨朝時自本住處發，來入此迦蘭陀園詣世尊所，
translation: He was the leader of the assembly, also accompanied by twenty-eight thousand people. In the morning he set out from his original dwelling place and came to this forest of Kalandaka’s grove to visit the World-honored One.

source_sentence: 恭敬合掌，頂禮佛足，退坐一面。
translation: He joined his palms in respect, bowed his head at the Buddha’s feet, withdrew, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，舍衛國復有長者名大善商主并彼給孤獨長者，為眾上首，亦與二萬八千人俱，
translation: At that time in Sāvatthī there was also an elder named Mahāsudassana, together with the other householder Anāthapiṇḍika. He was the leader of the assembly, accompanied by twenty-eight thousand people.

source_sentence: 自彼舍衛國詣王舍城入迦蘭陀園至世尊所，恭敬合掌，頂禮佛足，退坐一面。
translation: From Sāvatthī they proceeded to the city of Rājagaha, entered the Kalandaka Park, and arrived at the place where the World-honored One was. Respectfully joining their palms, they bowed their heads at the Buddha’s feet and withdrew to sit at one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，王舍大城復有長者名曰水天，為最上首，亦與二萬八千人俱，從本住處發，
translation: At that time, in the great city of Rājagaha, there was another wealthy man named Sudarśana, the foremost among the wealthiest householders, also accompanied by twenty-eight thousand people. He came from his original dwelling place.

source_sentence: 來入此迦蘭陀園詣世尊所，恭敬合掌，頂禮佛足，退坐一面。
translation: They came to this Kālānda’s pleasure grove and approached the World-honored One. Respectfully joining their palms in respect, they bowed at the Buddha’s feet and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，摩伽陀國主韋提希子、阿闍世王，亦與百千諸眷屬俱，於晨朝時亦來入此迦蘭陀園詣世尊所，
translation: At that time, the lord of Magadha, together with hundreds of thousands of his retainers, including King Vediṣṭacāritra and King Ajātaśatru, also came to this Kalandaka’s Park in the morning to visit the World-honored One.

source_sentence: 頂禮佛足，退坐一面。
translation: He bowed his head at the Buddha’s feet, withdrew, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，復有四大天王及天帝釋，乃至欲界一切天眾，各與無量百千億那由他眷屬天眾俱，
translation: At the time, there were also the four great celestial kings and Indra, as well as all the other gods in the heavens of the realm of desire, each accompanied by an immeasurable number of hundreds of thousands of myriads of koṭis of nayutas of their retinues.

source_sentence: 亦於晨朝悉來入迦蘭陀園至如來所，頂禮佛足，退坐一面。
translation: In the morning, they all came into the Kālānda’s grove and went to the place where the Tathāgata was. Having saluted the Buddha by bowing their foreheads at his feet, they withdrew and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，復有娑婆世界主大梵天王，亦與無量百千億那由他眷屬天眾俱，
translation: At that time there was also the great brahma celestial king Lord of the sahā world, together with innumerable hundreds of thousands of myriads of koṭis of nayutas of their retinues.

source_sentence: 於晨朝時悉入迦蘭陀園至如來所，頂禮佛足，退坐一面。
translation: In the morning, they all entered the Kālānda Park and went to the Tathāgata's place. After bowing their heads at his feet, they withdrew and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，復有大自在天王，亦與無量百千淨居諸天眾俱，於晨朝時悉入迦蘭陀園，
translation: At that time another great sovereign celestial king also entered the Kalandaka park in the morning, accompanied by countless hundreds of thousands of gods from the pure heavenly abodes.

source_sentence: 頂禮佛足，退坐一面。
translation: He bowed his head at the Buddha’s feet, withdrew, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，復有四阿脩羅王，各與無量百千眷屬阿脩羅眾俱，亦於晨朝入迦蘭陀園詣如來所，
translation: At that time, there were also four other titan kings, each accompanied by an assembly of innumerable hundreds of thousands of retinues of titans. In the morning they also entered the forest of Kalandaka’s grove and came before the World-honored One.

source_sentence: 頂禮佛足，退坐一面。
translation: He bowed his head at the Buddha’s feet, withdrew, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，復有難陀龍王及跋難陀龍王，各與無量百千眷屬諸龍眾俱，亦於晨朝入迦蘭陀園詣如來所，
translation: At that time, there were also the nāga kings Nanda and Upananda, each accompanied by innumerable hundreds of thousands of myriadstical retinues of dragons. Also they entered the forest of Kalandaka’s grove in the morning to approach the presence of the enlightened one.

source_sentence: 頂禮佛足，退坐一面。
translation: He bowed his head at the Buddha’s feet, withdrew, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，復有娑伽羅龍王、阿那婆達多龍王，及摩那斯龍王、伊跋羅龍王等，
translation: At that time there were also the nāga king Sāgara, the nāga king Anavatapta, the nāga king Manas, and the nāga king Ivara.

source_sentence: 各與無量百千眷屬諸龍眾俱，亦於晨朝入迦蘭陀園詣如來所，頂禮佛足，
translation: Each of them, accompanied by an assembly of countless hundreds of thousands of myriadstical retinues and dragons, also entered Kālānda’s park in the morning to see the World-honored One. They bowed at his feet with their heads at the Buddha’s feet.

source_sentence: 退坐一面。
translation: He withdrew and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，此三千大千世界一切諸比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷，及以一切天、龍、夜叉、乾闥婆、阿脩羅、迦樓羅、緊那羅、摩睺羅伽，
translation: At the time, all the monks, nuns, laymen, laymen, and laywomen of these 3,000 great one-thousand worlds, as well as all the gods, dragons, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, and mahoragas

source_sentence: 乃至人非人及諸王等信如來者，為聽法故，一切皆集迦蘭陀園詣如來所，
translation: Those who believe in the teachings of the buddhas and those who do not believe in them all assemble at Kalandaka’s Park to hear the Teaching.

source_sentence: 頂禮佛足，各坐一面。
translation: They bowed their heads at the Buddha’s feet and each sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時，迦蘭陀園其地弘廣如此，三千大千世界所有地方大眾充滿，無空缺處若杖頭許而不遍者。
translation: At the time, the ground of the Kālānda Park was so vast and vast that all the places in the 3,000 great one-thousand worlds were filled, and there's no place where an empty space isn't pervaded by anyone who doesn't reach it with a staff.

source_sentence: 如是，上至有頂、下逮梵宮，所有一切大威德神通諸天大眾，乃至一切諸龍、夜叉、乾闥婆、阿修羅、迦樓羅、緊那羅、摩睺羅伽、人非人等，
translation: Thus, from the top of the moon up to the palace of Bhavāgra and the lower part of the celestial assembly that pertains to Brahmā, there are all the gods with great authority and supernormal powers, as well as all the dragons, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas

source_sentence: 皆來集會。
translation: They all came to the assembly.

source_sentence: 爾時，賢護菩薩摩訶薩即從座起，偏袒右肩，右膝著地，合掌向佛白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, the Bhadrapāla Bodhisattva Mahāsattva rose from his seat, bared his right shoulder, knelt with his right knee on the ground, joined his palms and said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於今者欲得諮問如來、應供、等正覺心中所疑，不審世尊見垂聽不？」
translation: Now, I want to consult the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One about what's doubted in my mind, but I don't know whether the Bhagavān will listen.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊復告賢護菩薩言：「賢護！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān again addressed Bhadrapāla Bodhisattva, saying, Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 如來、世尊隨汝所疑，恣汝所問，為汝宣釋，令汝歡喜。」
translation: The Tathāgata and the Bhagavān will follow your doubts and allow you to ask questions, explain them for you, and make you rejoice.

source_sentence: 時彼賢護菩薩既蒙聽許，復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Having heard the permission, that Bhadrapāla Bodhisattva then again said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩具足成就何等三昧而能得彼大功德聚？
translation: What kind of concentration does a bodhisattva-mahāsattva fully accomplish that enables him to attain that great stock of merit?

source_sentence: 云何得入多聞大海獲智慧藏，問無疑惑故？
translation: How can they enter the great ocean of well-versed wisdom and attain the store of wisdom, asking questions without doubt?

source_sentence: 云何復得無意戒聚不失成就，於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提無退減故？
translation: How could they again attain the state of mindless precepts without losing their accomplishment, because they don't regress from unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment?

source_sentence: 復云何得不生愚癡，邪見空處故？
translation: How can it be that delusion doesn't arise, because it's the place of wrong views of emptiness?

source_sentence: 云何當得宿命智，遍知去來故？
translation: How will they attain the knowledge of past lives, knowing all pasts and futures?

source_sentence: 云何當得不離奉見諸佛、世尊，聽聞正法乃至夢中故？
translation: How will they attain the ability to hear the right teaching without leaving and venerate the buddhas and world-honored ones, even in a dream?

source_sentence: 云何當得殊特端正上妙色身、具足威儀，眾生樂見故？
translation: How will they attain an extraordinarily handsome body of marvelous form and full comportment, which sentient beings delight in seeing?

source_sentence: 云何當得常生大姓之家、尊貴之位，見者恭敬故？
translation: How will they always be born in a great family and at the rank of nobility, being respected by those who see them?

source_sentence: 云何復得父母、兄弟、宗親、眷屬及以知識左右圍遶，恒無別離故？
translation: How could they be surrounded by their parents, brothers, relatives, retinues, and friends, because they're always without separation?

source_sentence: 云何當得廣達博通，所為殊異亦終無缺減於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心故？
translation: How will they attain extensive comprehension and vast penetration, with distinctions in what they do that are never absent from the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment?

source_sentence: 云何當得正念、正行，節度不移、心知足故？
translation: How will they attain right mindfulness and right practice, which are based on moderation without moving and the mind being contented?

source_sentence: 云何當得常生慚愧，遠離恥辱故？
translation: How will they always have shame, because they're free of shame?

source_sentence: 云何當得正智謙恭，降伏我慢故？
translation: How will they attain correct knowledge and humility, subduing self-conceit?

source_sentence: 云何當得策懃精進，遠離懈怠故？
translation: How will they be able to encourage vigorous effort, because they're free of laziness?

source_sentence: 云何當得大慈、大悲、大喜、大捨，平等與樂故？
translation: How will they attain great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and great equanimity, which are equal and pleasant?

source_sentence: 云何當得聞說甚深真空、無相、無願法時，一切無有驚怖、退沒故？
translation: How will they be able to hear and teach the profound teaching of the dharmas of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, all without fear or retrogression?

source_sentence: 云何當得不樂懶惰，攝受正法故？
translation: How will they attain the absence of pleasure and laziness because they'll gather in the right teaching?

source_sentence: 云何當得智慧通達，明了一切無與等者故？
translation: How will they attain the penetration of wisdom, which clearly understands that all things are peerless?

source_sentence: 云何當得於一切佛剎隨意得生故？
translation: How will they be able to give rise to all buddha-lands as they wish?

source_sentence: 云何當得不為一切外道所摧壞故？
translation: How will it be attained because it won't be destroyed by all the non-Buddhist teachings?

source_sentence: 云何當得如海，能受納眾問疑、釋難，無減、無盡故？
translation: How will it be attained like an ocean that's able to receive and accept questions, doubts, and explanations of difficulties without decrease or exhaustion?

source_sentence: 云何當得如月滿白淨，法具足故？
translation: How will they attain purity like the full whiteness of the moon, because they're fully endowed with the Dharma?

source_sentence: 云何當得如日初出，破諸闇冥故？
translation: How could it be like when the sun first rises, destroying darkness and darkness?

source_sentence: 云何當得如燈炬，光明照了故？
translation: How could it be obtained like a torch, because its light illuminates and comprehends?

source_sentence: 云何當得如虛空性，無有罣礙故？
translation: How will they attain the nature of space, which has no obstruction?

source_sentence: 云何當得無所住著，心如虛空故？
translation: How will it be attained without abiding attachment, because the mind is like space?

source_sentence: 云何當得如金剛穿徹，通達一切法故？
translation: How will they attain penetration like a diamond, comprehending all dharmas?

source_sentence: 云何當得如須彌山，不可動搖故？
translation: How could it be like Mount Sumeru, which can't be shaken?

source_sentence: 云何當得如門閫，一切正住故？
translation: How will they attain thusness of the gate, because all are correctly abiding?

source_sentence: 云何當得如猫、狗、獸等，心業成就故？
translation: How will it be attained, like cats, dogs, animals, and so forth, because of the accomplishment of mental action?

source_sentence: 云何當得無為，一切諸法中故？
translation: How will they attain nonexistence, because it's among all dharmas?

source_sentence: 云何當得如飛鳥，隨意而去故？
translation: How could it be like a flying bird that leaves at will?

source_sentence: 云何當得摧折憍慢，如旃陀羅子故？
translation: How will they be able to break down their conceit, just like the children of Candra?

source_sentence: 云何當得住阿蘭若，如諸獸、獼猴等不樂城邑聚落，一切出家、在家不相參亂故？
translation: How will they be allowed to live in a forest, like animals and rhesus monkeys who don't delight in cities or villages, and all renunciants and householders won't disturb each other?

source_sentence: 云何當得統領大眾，教詔導示故？
translation: How will they be able to lead the masses and teach and guide them?

source_sentence: 云何當得不樂生一切眾生中，不動於一切眾生故？
translation: How will they attain the unhappy birth among all sentient beings because they don't move toward all sentient beings?

source_sentence: 云何當得不為一切外道，降伏天魔惑亂故？
translation: How will it be possible to subdue the confusion of heavenly Māra and not become a follower of all non-Buddhist teachings?

source_sentence: 云何當得大辯才，於一切法決了知故？
translation: How will they attain great eloquence, knowing all things with certainty?

source_sentence: 云何當得於一切佛法，不隨他行故？
translation: How will they attain all the Buddha's teachings because they won't follow others' actions?

source_sentence: 云何當得大堅固信，無可毀壞故？
translation: How will they attain great firm faith, which cannot be destroyed?

source_sentence: 云何當得大慈力，信不可動故？
translation: How will they attain the power of great compassion because their faith is immovable?

source_sentence: 云何當得深入信，無所行故？
translation: How will they attain deep faith, because there's nothing to practice?

source_sentence: 云何當得潤澤信，於一切法中多歡喜故？
translation: How will they attain nourishing faith because they'll be overjoyed in all dharmas?

source_sentence: 云何當得最勝信，供養承事一切諸佛無厭足故？
translation: How will they attain the most excellent faith, making offerings to and serving all the buddhas without tire?

source_sentence: 云何當得種種入信，種諸善根故？
translation: How will they attain various kinds of entering faith, planting good roots?

source_sentence: 云何當得真妙信，增長無虛偽行故？
translation: How will they attain true and marvelous faith, which grows without false actions?

source_sentence: 云何當得淨喜信，除滅一切嫉妬故？
translation: How will they attain pure joy and faith, which removes all jealousy?

source_sentence: 云何當得清淨信，得一切種智光明故？
translation: How will they attain pure faith and attain the light of all kinds of knowledge?

source_sentence: 云何當得喜樂行信，除滅諸蓋、障惡故？
translation: How will they attain the faith of joyful practice, which removes the hindrances and hindrances that are bad?

source_sentence: 云何當得智喜信，攝受諸佛境界故？
translation: How will they attain knowledge, joy, and faith because they embrace the buddha-realms?

source_sentence: 云何當得莊嚴行信，勝一切世間瓔珞莊嚴佛國清淨成就故？
translation: How will they attain the faith of adorned practice, which is superior to all worldly diadem-adorned buddha-lands because it's purely accomplished?

source_sentence: 云何當得清淨戒行，永滅一切聲聞、辟支佛心故？
translation: How will they attain the practice of pure morality, which permanently extinguishes the minds of all śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas?

source_sentence: 云何當得莊嚴大誓，一切所作皆究竟故？
translation: How will they attain the great vow of adornment, which accomplishes all their actions?

source_sentence: 云何當得為一切眾生中上首，欲行諸善法故？
translation: How will they become the foremost among all sentient beings because they want to practice good qualities?

source_sentence: 云何當得無有疲倦，為欲教授一切菩薩所學諸波羅蜜故？
translation: How will they attain the absence of weariness because they want to teach all the perfections studied by enlightening beings?

source_sentence: 云何當得不退轉，多求一切佛法故？
translation: How will they attain nonretrogression because they often seek all the Buddha's teachings?

source_sentence: 云何當得不可壞，不為一切外道邪師所破故？
translation: How will it be attained and indestructible, because it won't be refuted by all the mistaken teachers of non-Buddhists?

source_sentence: 云何當得深信一切諸佛，不捨此念常見諸佛故？
translation: How will they attain deep faith in all the buddhas and not abandon this thought because they always see the buddhas?

source_sentence: 云何當得如父想，紹隆一切佛法故？
translation: How will they attain the perception of being like a father and promote all the Buddha's teachings?

source_sentence: 云何當得佛力加持，於一切佛法光明中生故？
translation: How will they attain the Buddha's power and empowerment, which are born in the light of all the Buddha's teachings?

source_sentence: 云何當得無障礙，一切佛法悉現在前故？
translation: How will they attain unobstructedness because all the Buddha's teachings are fully present in front of them?

source_sentence: 云何當得如幻人，於一切法無思念故？
translation: How will they attain the illusion of being like an illusory person who has no thoughts about all things?

source_sentence: 云何當得如化者，觀一切法無生、滅故？
translation: How will he attain such a transformation because he observes that all things lack arising and ceasing?

source_sentence: 云何當得如夢，觀察三世無來、去故？
translation: How could it be obtained like a dream, observing the three times without coming or going?

source_sentence: 云何當得如鏡像，一切世界斯現身中故？
translation: How could it be obtained like a mirror image, because all worlds are reflected in my body?

source_sentence: 云何當得如響聲，一切法無作、無為，因緣生故？
translation: How will it be attained like a resonant sound that all things are unconstructed and unconditioned, because of the causes and conditions that give rise to them?

source_sentence: 云何當得如形影，於一切生法自無心取捨故？
translation: How will they attain such form and shadow, because they themselves have no mind to grasp or reject all the things that arise?

source_sentence: 云何當得空無所有，遠離一切諸物想故？
translation: How will they attain emptiness without existence because they're free of the perception of all things?

source_sentence: 云何當得無相，觀一切法無有二故？
translation: How will they attain signlessness, observing that all things are without duality?

source_sentence: 云何當得法界邊際，菩提心無限量故？
translation: How will they attain the limits of the Dharma realm, because their mind of enlightenment has no limit?

source_sentence: 云何當得不起著，一切世界性無分別故？
translation: How will it be attained without attachment, because the nature of all worlds has no discrimination?

source_sentence: 云何當得無礙行，遍遊一切諸佛剎中故？
translation: How will they attain unobstructed practice because they travel to all the buddha-lands?

source_sentence: 云何當得諸陀羅尼，聞一知萬，善達一切文字分別說故？
translation: How will they attain the dhāraṇī, hear one and know ten thousand, and skillfully understand all words and explain them separately?

source_sentence: 云何當得如諸法師，善知一切佛法故？
translation: How will they attain the masters of the Dharma who are well versed in all the Buddha's teachings?

source_sentence: 云何當得一切諸佛所護念，一切佛威力加持故？
translation: How will they attain the protection of all buddhas and be supported by the authoritative power of all buddhas?

source_sentence: 云何當得雄猛不怯弱，出聲如大牛王及大師子王步故？
translation: How will they attain heroic and not faint-hearted, producing sounds like the steps of a great ox king or a great lion king?

source_sentence: 云何當得無畏，令一切世間歡喜故？
translation: How will they attain fearlessness, causing all the worlds to rejoice?

source_sentence: 云何當得無疑惑，於一切佛平等無二故？
translation: How will they attain the absence of doubt and doubt, because all buddhas are equal and without duality?

source_sentence: 云何當得通達如如滅除疑惑，不著諸法故？
translation: How will they attain comprehension of thusness and thusness and be freed from doubt and confusion, because they don't cling to dharmas?

source_sentence: 云何當得證深法界，善能解釋所問義故？
translation: How will they attain realization of the profound realm of reality because they can skillfully explain the meaning of the questions asked?

source_sentence: 云何當得師利益他，具足大慈故？
translation: How will they attain the master's benefit for others and be endowed with great kindness?

source_sentence: 云何當得滅除懶惰，恒樂說法故？
translation: How will they attain the cessation of laziness, because they always delight in teaching the Dharma?

source_sentence: 云何當得如法住，不捨一切眾生故？
translation: How will they be able to abide according to the teaching, not abandoning all sentient beings?

source_sentence: 云何當得不諂曲，性淳直故？
translation: How will they attain the quality of not being flattering, because their nature is simple and straightforward?

source_sentence: 云何當得如眼目，為一切世間燈明故？
translation: How could it be obtained like the eye, because it's the light of all worldly lamps?

source_sentence: 云何當得不可輕蔑，勝出一切三界故？
translation: How will it be attained and not despised because it's superior to all the three realms?

source_sentence: 云何當得無諍論，如教說行故？
translation: How will they attain the absence of disputes, because they're practiced as taught?

source_sentence: 云何當得無艱難，行無住著故？
translation: How will it be attained without difficulty, because there's no abiding attachment in practice?

source_sentence: 云何當得知於實際，不分別諸法故？
translation: How should they be known in reality because they don't discriminate dharmas?

source_sentence: 云何當得說一切語言智，令諸眾生住於大乘故？
translation: How will they attain the knowledge of all languages, which will cause sentient beings to abide in the great vehicle?

source_sentence: 云何當得至無畏處，遠離恐怖，永無一切毛竪等事故？
translation: How will you attain the state of fearlessness, be far removed from fear, and never have any hair standing on your head?

source_sentence: 云何當得知佛方便說，善達一切修多羅等故？
translation: How should you know that the Buddha skillfully explains it because he well understands all the sūtras and so forth?

source_sentence: 云何當得不空生世間，恒入一切眾中獲利故？
translation: How will they attain the world of nonempty birth, which always enters into all sentient beings for their benefit?

source_sentence: 云何當得為一切智首，於一切世間應受供養大名聞故？
translation: How will they attain the position of head of omniscience, which should be honored in all worlds and greatly renowned?

source_sentence: 云何當得無邊讚歎功德，為一切眾生福田故？
translation: How will they attain limitless praise and merit because it's a field of merit for all sentient beings?

source_sentence: 云何當得大歡喜踊躍無量，常在諸如來師子座下故？
translation: How will they attain great joy and dance without measure because they'll always be under the lion seat of the tathāgatas?

source_sentence: 云何當得勝上辯才，能問一切佛法故？
translation: How will they attain superior eloquence, being able to ask questions about all the Buddha's teachings?

source_sentence: 云何當得意不怯弱辯才，於一切大眾中無怖畏故？
translation: How should you concentrate on the power of not being faint-hearted and eloquent, so that there's no fear in all the masses?

source_sentence: 云何當得一切論議辯如師子王，降伏一切外道、攝受諸異論師故？
translation: How will they attain the eloquence of all arguments like a lion king who subdues all non-Buddhist teachers and takes in heretical theories?

source_sentence: 云何當得不壞本誓莊嚴，欲摧一切邪異朋黨故？
translation: How will they attain the adornment of the indestructible original vow because they want to destroy all wrong and distasteful friends?

source_sentence: 云何當得善巧說法、常處師子座，一切諸佛印可故？
translation: How will they skillfully teach the Dharma and always sit on a lion's seat, because all the buddhas approve of them?

source_sentence: 云何當得遠離一切世間無義語言，以通達一切正教故？
translation: How will they attain freedom from all worldly, meaningless speech because they comprehend all the right teachings?

source_sentence: 云何當得深愛一切諸佛法，於諸如來生處行故？
translation: How will they attain profound love for all the buddha-teachings because they practice in the birthplace of the enlightened ones?

source_sentence: 云何當得樂欲真法，知諸如來不生故？
translation: How will they attain the true dharma of pleasure and desire, knowing that the tathāgatas won't arise?

source_sentence: 云何當得不懈慢，善承事知識故？
translation: How will they attain the absence of arrogance because they serve their teachers well?

source_sentence: 云何當得不染著，遊行一切世界故？
translation: How will it be attained without defiled attachment, traveling to all worlds?

source_sentence: 云何當得願行具足，為教化一切眾生故？
translation: How will they attain the fulfillment of their vows and practices in order to teach all sentient beings?

source_sentence: 云何當得如珊瑚，得諸相故？
translation: How will they attain it like coral, because they'll attain the characteristics?

source_sentence: 云何當得如虛空，一切法無得相故？
translation: How will it be attained like space, because all dharmas lack the characteristics of attainment?

source_sentence: 云何當得如菩薩，不斷佛種故？
translation: How will it be attained like a bodhisattva who doesn't stop the seed of Buddhahood?

source_sentence: 云何當得不休息行，諸菩薩道未曾遠離大乘故？
translation: How will they attain unceasing practice, because the bodhisattva paths have never been apart from the great vehicle?

source_sentence: 云何當得著大鎧甲，諸佛廣大戒中決定住故？
translation: How will they be able to put on the great armor, because they'll surely abide in the vast precepts of the buddhas?

source_sentence: 云何當得一切諸佛所讚、灌頂，住於諸如來十力地中故？
translation: How will they attain the praise and consecration of all the buddhas and abide in the ten powers of the enlightened ones?

source_sentence: 云何當得一切所想，通達一切諸法行故？
translation: How will they attain all conceptions and comprehend the practice of all dharmas?

source_sentence: 云何當得一切算數，巧方便知故？
translation: How will they attain all calculations, which are skillfully known by skillful means?

source_sentence: 云何當得善知一切成壞，遠離一切障礙行故？
translation: How will they attain good knowledge of all formations and disintegrations, being free of all obstructive actions?

source_sentence: 云何當得一切不住行，不取、不捨故？
translation: How will they attain all the practices that don't abide, which are not grasped or abandoned?

source_sentence: 云何當得一切大施主，能施無悔故？
translation: How will they attain all the great donors, who can give without regret?

source_sentence: 云何當得入諸法海，能施勝上法寶藏故？
translation: How will they be able to enter the ocean of all dharmas and be able to bestow the treasury of the supreme treasure of the Dharma?

source_sentence: 云何當得一切世間行，能捨世間諸相故？
translation: How will they attain all worldly actions because they'll be able to abandon worldly characteristics?

source_sentence: 云何當得廣大神通，隨順諸佛神通滿足歡喜故？
translation: How will they attain vast supernormal powers, following the buddhas' supernormal powers and rejoicing in their fulfillment?

source_sentence: 云何當得一剎那時間行即能遍至一切諸佛前故？
translation: How will it be possible to attain the timely practice of one moment, which is able to reach all buddhas before them?

source_sentence: 復云何當得住此佛剎遍見一切十方諸佛、聽聞正法、供養眾僧，非但未得出世六通、而實未得世間五通，
translation: “Furthermore, how can one who dwells in this buddha-land pervade all the buddhas of the ten directions and hear the Teaching from these buddhas or honor them? Not only has he not yet attained the six superknowledgements of worldly existence, but he also has not really attained the five superknowledgements of worldly existence.

source_sentence: 而亦未捨此世界身、亦無生彼諸佛國土、唯住此土見餘世界諸佛、世尊，
translation: They do not abandon the bodies of this world, nor do they give rise to the buddha-lands of those buddhas. They live only in these buddha-lands and see the buddhas and Buddhas of other worlds.

source_sentence: 悉聞諸佛所宣正法、一切聽受如說修行？
translation: Do you all hear the right teaching proclaimed by the buddhas and listen to and practice it as they teach it?

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 譬如今時聖者阿難於世尊前親聞法已，皆悉受持、如說奉行；
translation: It is as if the holy one Ānanda had heard the Dharma directly from the World-honored One, retaining it and following it exactly as he taught it.

source_sentence: 彼諸菩薩身居此土不至彼界而能遍覩諸佛、世尊，聽聞法已悉能受持、如說修行，
translation: Those enlightening beings, residing in this land but not reaching there, can see all buddhas and world-honored ones everywhere. Having heard the Teaching, they are able to retain it and practice it accordingly.

source_sentence: 亦復如是。
translation: It's likewise.

source_sentence: 從是已後，一切生處常不遠離諸佛、世尊，聽聞正法，乃至夢中咸若斯也。」
translation: From then on, all the places where they're born will always be not far from the buddhas and world-honored ones, and they'll hear the right teaching, even in a dream.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告賢護菩薩摩訶薩言：「善哉，善哉。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the Bhadrapāla Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, saying, Good, good!

source_sentence: 賢護！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 汝今乃能請問如來如是妙義，汝為利益一切世間諸眾生故、亦為安樂諸眾生故、復為憐愍諸天人故、復為攝受未來世中諸菩薩故。
translation: Now, you're able to ask the Tathāgata about such a marvelous meaning for the sake of benefiting all sentient beings in the world, bringing peace to sentient beings, pitying gods and humans, and taking in bodhisattvas in future lives.

source_sentence: 「賢護！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 而汝往昔已曾供養無量諸佛、種諸善根、聽聞正法、受持正法、愛樂正法、敬重正法；
translation: In the past you served innumerable buddhas, planted roots of goodness, listened to the Teaching, preserved it, cherished it, and revered it.

source_sentence: 汝今但以摩訶迦葉教化行故，少欲知足，恒樂閑靜阿蘭若處——或居塚間、或在樹下、亦露地坐，
translation: “No sooner had you undertaken the instruction and guidance of Mahākāśyapa than you became contented with few desires. You always enjoyed living in a quiet, secluded forest dwelling place, either in a cemetery or at the foot of a tree or on the ground.

source_sentence: 常坐不臥，一敷不移，受乞食法，一食不再，或一坐食、或唯一摶，唯畜三衣及糞掃衣，
translation: They always sit and don’t lie down; they do not move one piece of the bed. They follow the rules for begging almsfood, accepting only three kinds of cloth or rag-covered robes [to cover the wound] when going out to eat once a day.

source_sentence: 讚歎頭陀，勸請諸菩薩、教菩薩行法、令諸菩薩喜、訶責諸菩薩、教示諸菩薩、成就諸菩薩，
translation: They praised the ascetic, exhorted the enlightening beings, taught the practices of enlightening beings, made them delighted, reproached the enlightening beings, instructed and inspired the enlightening beings, and perfected the enlightening beings.

source_sentence: 能為利益行大慈悲，於諸眾生生平等心。
translation: They can practice great compassion for the benefit of sentient beings and give rise to equanimity toward sentient beings.

source_sentence: 咸得自在到於彼岸，隨意得見一切諸佛，發廣大願、行深妙行，樂一切智菩提梁柱，
translation: They all attain freedom to reach the other shore, and can see all buddhas as they wish. They undertake great vows and carry out profound and wondrous practices, delighting in the beams of omniscience and enlightenment.

source_sentence: 善能隨順如來種性，發菩提心猶如金剛。
translation: They can skillfully follow the Tathāgata's seed nature and give rise to the mind of enlightenment like a vajra.

source_sentence: 通達世間眾生所念，廣大妙行不可校算、不可稱量，常在一切諸佛目前。
translation: He comprehends the vast and marvelous actions of worldly sentient beings' thoughts, which can't be measured or counted, and always stands in front of all the buddhas.

source_sentence: 賢護！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 於汝功德中未說少分也。
translation: I won't explain a small part of your merit.

source_sentence: 「賢護！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 今有菩薩三昧名曰思惟諸佛現前三昧。
translation: Now, there's a bodhisattva samādhi called the samādhi of contemplating the buddhas as they are manifested.

source_sentence: 若有菩薩具足修習如是三昧，當得成就如上所問諸功德等。
translation: If there are bodhisattvas who fully cultivate such concentration, they'll attain the merits and so forth of the above-mentioned questions.

source_sentence: 賢護當知，更有無量無邊勝上功德，說不可盡。」
translation: Bhadrapāla, you should know that there's an immeasurable, limitless, and superior merit that can't be described in detail.

source_sentence: 爾時，賢護菩薩復白佛言：「善哉，世尊！
translation: It was then that the Bhadrapāla Bodhisattva again said to the Buddha, Good, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 唯願說此菩薩念一切佛現前三昧，令此世間天、人、梵、魔、沙門、婆羅門、諸龍、夜叉、乾闥婆、阿脩羅、迦樓羅、緊那羅、摩睺羅伽、人非人等，
translation: “World-honored One, please explain how this bodhisattva is mindful of all buddhas’ manifestations of concentration so that gods, humans, Brahmās, Māras, śramaṇas, brāhmaṇas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and nonhumans in

source_sentence: 多獲利益、多受安樂故，亦令當來無量眾生多得利益受安樂故，又為未來諸菩薩輩作大光明承受威力故。
translation: Because they often attain benefit and comfort, they'll also cause measureless sentient beings in the future to attain benefit and comfort, and they'll create a great radiance for the bodhisattvas of the future that bears their authority.

source_sentence: 又，願現在、未來諸菩薩等普得聞此念一切佛現前三昧；
translation: Also, may all enlightening beings of the present and future hear this thought of the manifestation of all buddhas in concentration.

source_sentence: 彼既聞已皆悉受持；
translation: Having heard it, they all retain it.

source_sentence: 既受持已一切皆當如實修學、如教奉行；
translation: Having received and upheld them, they should all be truly cultivated and practiced according to their teachings.

source_sentence: 既學行已，當令得不退轉於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，現前即能具足成就如是功德及餘勝上功德等。」
translation: After training and practicing them, they'll attain unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment without regressing, and they'll be able to fully accomplish such merits and other superior qualities in the present.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊復告賢護菩薩言：「賢護！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān again addressed Bhadrapāla Bodhisattva, saying, Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 如汝言者，汝當諦聽，善思念之，吾今為汝分別解脫。」
translation: If you do as you say, listen closely and consider it well; now I'll explain liberation for you.

source_sentence: 賢護復言：「善哉，世尊！
translation: Again, Bhadrapāla said, Good, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我深樂聞如來所說。」
translation: I'm deeply happy to hear what the Tathāgata teaches.

source_sentence: 佛復告言：「賢護！
translation: Again, the Buddha told him, Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 云何名為菩薩思惟一切諸佛現前三昧？
translation: What is called the bodhisattva's concentration of contemplating all the buddhas as they are manifested?

source_sentence: 若有菩薩具足成就此三昧者，即獲如前諸功德事，亦得其餘殊異功德，
translation: If there are bodhisattvas who fully accomplish this concentration, they’ll attain the same kinds of extraordinary qualities as the previous ones and attain the other extraordinary qualities.

source_sentence: 所謂心念諸佛皆現在前，其心不亂、不捨作業。
translation: The so-called mind is mindful of the buddhas that are all present, and its mind isn't disturbed or distracted by actions.

source_sentence: 求勝上智勇猛精勤，荷負重擔度脫眾生。
translation: Seeking superior wisdom, they are courageous and diligent, bearing a heavy burden and liberating sentient beings.

source_sentence: 承事、供給諸善知識，常修空寂廣大思惟。
translation: He serves and provides for good teachers, always cultivating the vast contemplation of emptiness and quiescence.

source_sentence: 親善知識、滅除諸蓋，遠離惡友、息世語言、塞諸根門。
translation: Being close to good friends, he extinguishes the hindrances, parts with bad friends, stops worldly speech, and obstructs the gate of faculties.

source_sentence: 初、中、後夜減損睡眠，不貪衣服、食飲、湯藥、堂房、屋宇、床座、眾具，
translation: The first, middle, and last watches of the night reduce sleep. They do not covet clothes, food or drink, hot water or medicine, dwellings, houses, beds, seats, or other necessities.

source_sentence: 恒樂空閑，住阿蘭若。
translation: They always delight in leisurely seclusion and live in a forest.

source_sentence: 不愛己身、不重我命，不著形色、不縱其心，修以慈心、薰以悲行、一切時喜、常行捨心。
translation: He doesn't love his own body, doesn't value self and life, doesn't cling to form and form, doesn't control his mind, cultivates the mind with kindness, perfumes it with compassion, always delights in all things, and always practices equanimity.

source_sentence: 破壞煩惱，成就諸禪，於中思惟不著滋味。
translation: He destroys afflictions, accomplishes meditations, and contemplates them without attachment or taste.

source_sentence: 觀察色想唯得空心，不亂正念、不取諸陰、不著諸入、不思諸界、不貪生處。
translation: He observes form and perception only to attain emptiness, doesn't disturb right mindfulness, doesn't grasp the aggregates, doesn't cling to the sense-fields, doesn't contemplate the elements, and doesn't crave the place of birth.

source_sentence: 調伏慢高，不妬他財，為諸世間多作饒益。
translation: They subdue conceit and arrogance, aren't jealous of others' possessions, and often work for the benefit of the world.

source_sentence: 於諸眾生起平等心、又於眾生生父母想、亦於眾生所作一子心。
translation: They give rise to the mind of equality for sentient beings, give rise to the perception of parents for sentient beings, and also give rise to the mind of one child for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 一切法中無有諍想，雖念持戒而不執著，常在禪定亦無躭染。
translation: In all dharmas, there's no conception of anger, and even though he's mindful of observing precepts without clinging to them, he's always in meditation and has no anger or defilement.

source_sentence: 好樂多聞，不起分別，戒聚不缺、定聚不動、智聚不妄。
translation: They are fond of learning much and don't discriminate, the stock of precepts is not deficient, the stock of concentration doesn't move, and the stock of wisdom isn't false.

source_sentence: 諸法無疑，不背諸佛、不謗正法、不壞眾僧、不好乖離。
translation: They have no doubt about the teachings, don't turn against the buddhas, don't denigrate the right teaching, don't destroy the saṃgha, and don't disagree with them.

source_sentence: 親近眾聖、遠離愚癡，不志求出世。
translation: Being intimate with the sages and far removed from folly, they don't aspire to leave the world.

source_sentence: 雖聞語言，意不樂聽，亦不耽著世間六味。
translation: Even though he hears words, his mind isn't happy to listen, and he doesn't cling to the six flavors of the world.

source_sentence: 習近熏修五解脫法，除滅十惡、念修十善，斷滅眾生九種惱處、心常不離九想觀門，
translation: He cultivates and practices the five principles of liberation, getting rid of the ten evil deeds and mentally cultivating the ten wholesome deeds. He extinguishes the nine kinds of afflictions that afflict sentient beings and keeps his mind always engaged in these nine contemplations.

source_sentence: 常思棄捐八種懈怠、一心修習八大人覺，不著禪味、不恃多聞，摧伏我慢，
translation: They always think and abandon the eight kinds of laziness, singlemindedly cultivate the eight great forms of enlightenment, don’t cling to the taste of meditation or rely on much learning, and overcome self-conceit.

source_sentence: 一心聽受。
translation: With one mind, he listens and receives.

source_sentence: 求法慇重修道證知，憐愍眾生離我分別，求壽命想畢竟難得、觀察諸陰無有物想，
translation: Seeking the debilitating hindrances of dharmas to cultivate realization, pitying sentient beings who are free of self and discriminating themselves from self, seeking conceptions of life as ultimately hard to attain, observing that all aggregates have no conceptions of things,

source_sentence: 不住涅槃、不著生死。
translation: They don't abide in nirvāṇa and don't cling to birth and death.

source_sentence: 諸行煩惱輪，發大恐怖想；
translation: The wheel of afflictions of conditioned phenomena gave rise to great fear and thought.

source_sentence: 諸陰，怨家想；
translation: The aggregates are conceptions of enemies.

source_sentence: 諸入，空宅想；
translation: The sense-fields are conceptions of emptiness as a house.

source_sentence: 諸界，毒蛇想；
translation: The elements are the perception of poisonous snakes.

source_sentence: 三界，衰惱想；
translation: The third is perception of the three realms as decay.

source_sentence: 涅槃，利安想。
translation: Nirvāṇa is the perception of benefit and peace.

source_sentence: 觀諸欲惡猶如唾涕，深樂出家，不違佛教。
translation: He observes that the evil of desire is like spitting and weeping, and he deeply delights in leaving home without disobeying Buddhism.

source_sentence: 於眾生所勸行功德、於諸世界無復染心。
translation: They're encouraged by the merits of sentient beings and no longer have defiled minds in the worlds.

source_sentence: 見一切佛皆悉現前、受一切身皆若幻夢，一切諸相觀察滅除，思惟往來不見三世。
translation: Seeing all buddhas are fully manifested, feeling all bodies as if they were illusory dreams, observing all marks and ceasing them, he contemplates the past and future and doesn't see the three times.

source_sentence: 於信清淨深信真妙，念一切佛三世平等，無有動轉而能持諸善根。
translation: They deeply believe in the purity of faith and truly believe in the marvelous, remembering that all buddhas are equal in the three worlds, have no movement but can maintain good roots.

source_sentence: 一切諸佛三昧自在，終不染著諸佛相身。
translation: All the buddhas' samādhis are unimpeded, and they never become stained by the characteristic bodies of the buddhas.

source_sentence: 於一切法皆悉平等，不與一切世間共諍。
translation: They are completely equal in all things, and they don't fight with all the world.

source_sentence: 所可應作不相違背，通達甚深十二因緣，窮盡一切如來道地，得勝上忍入真法界。
translation: What should be done is not contradictory, penetrates the profound twelve causes and conditions, exhausts all the Tathāgata's path of enlightenment, attains superior forbearance, and enters the true Dharma realm.

source_sentence: 見眾生界性無生滅、見涅槃界本來現前，慧眼清淨，觀法無二。
translation: Seeing the nature of the sentient being realm as nonarising and seeing the original manifestation of the realm of nirvāṇa, the eye of wisdom is purified, and observing things are not two.

source_sentence: 彼菩提心無中、無邊，一切諸佛體無差異。
translation: The mind of enlightenment is neither middling nor limitless, and the bodies of all buddhas are not different.

source_sentence: 入於無礙清淨智門，明見菩提自然覺智。
translation: He enters the gate of unobstructed pure cognition, which explains the natural awakening and knowledge of seeing enlightenment.

source_sentence: 於善知識起諸佛想、於菩薩所不念乖離。
translation: They give rise to the perception of buddhas in good friends and don't think of or disagree with bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 已於生死破壞魔軍，一切眾事皆悉如化。
translation: Having destroyed the armies of Māra in birth and death, all things are like phantoms.

source_sentence: 見諸如來如鏡中像，應當求彼菩提之心。
translation: Seeing the tathāgatas as images in a mirror, you should seek their mind of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 諸波羅蜜莫不平等，實際無盡集佛功德。
translation: None of the perfections are equal, and they really don't exhaustively gather the merits of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 「賢護！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 是為菩薩思惟諸佛現前三昧。
translation: This is the bodhisattva's samādhi of contemplating the buddhas as they are manifested.

source_sentence: 若有菩薩摩訶薩欲具成就如是三昧，當先成就如是功德。
translation: If there are bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas who want to accomplish such a concentration, they must first accomplish such merit.

source_sentence: 賢護當知，更有無量功德然亦緣此三昧而生。」
translation: Bhadrapāla, you should know that there's an immeasurable amount of merit that also arises because of this concentration.

source_sentence: 佛復告賢護言：「是中何等三昧能生如是諸功德行？
translation: Again, the Buddha told Bhadrapāla, What kind of samādhi can produce such meritorious actions?

source_sentence: 所謂菩薩思惟諸佛現前三昧能生如是諸功德法。
translation: It's called a bodhisattva contemplating the buddhas' present samādhi that produces such meritorious qualities.

source_sentence: 「復次，賢護！
translation: Furthermore, Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 云何名為菩薩思惟諸佛現前三昧也？
translation: What's called the bodhisattva's concentration of contemplating the buddhas as they are manifested?

source_sentence: 賢護！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 若有比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷，清淨持戒、具足諸行，獨處空閑如是思惟：『於一切處隨何方所即若西方阿彌陀如來、應供、等正覺？』
translation: Suppose there are monks, nuns, laymen, laymen, and laymen who purely observe precepts and fulfill their practices and are alone in a quiet place and thus contemplate, 'In all places wherever they are, what's Amitâbha Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Enlightened One from the West?'

source_sentence: 是人爾時如所聞已，即應自作如是想念：『如我所聞：彼阿彌陀如來、應供、等正覺今在西方，
translation: Having thus heard, that person should think to himself: As I have heard, the Tathāgata Amitâbha, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One is now in the West.

source_sentence: 經途去此過百千億諸佛國土，彼有世界名曰安樂。
translation: Along the way, past hundreds of thousands of myriads of koṭis of buddha lands, there was a world called Anāthapiṇḍika.

source_sentence: 如是，如來今現在彼為諸菩薩周匝圍遶，處大眾中說法教化。』
translation: Thus, the Tathāgata is now present there, surrounded by bodhisattvas, teaching and transforming them in the great assembly.'

source_sentence: 然而是人依所聞故，繫念、思惟、觀察不已了了分明，終獲見彼阿彌陀如來、應供、等正覺也。
translation: However, that person relies on what they've heard, fix their thoughts, contemplate, and observe it without stopping to understand it clearly, and they'll eventually attain the view that Amitâbha is the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Enlightened.

source_sentence: 「復次，賢護！
translation: Furthermore, Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 譬如世間若男、若女，於睡夢中見種種事——所謂金、銀、眾寶、珍財、倉庫，
translation: It's like when a man or woman in the world sees various things in a dream, such as gold, silver, all kinds of treasures, precious possessions, and a storehouse.

source_sentence: 或見朋友、諸知識輩，或見覺時心不樂者——是人夢中所對境界，或違、或順，
translation: If someone sees friends or groups of friends, or sees that their mind isn't happy at the time of awakening-that person's objection in a dream is either contrary or agreeable,

source_sentence: 或憂、或喜，有時語言歡欣極樂、有時躁慼盡意悲哀，是人寤已思惟、憶念，
translation: Whether grieved or delighted, sometimes speech rejoicing in extreme bliss, sometimes agitated and distressed, that person’s sorrowful thoughts are reflected upon and remembered after waking.

source_sentence: 如夢所見為他廣宣，追念夢中便生憂喜。
translation: It's like seeing what's seen in a dream and explaining it widely for others, and then grief and joy arise in the dream when they're pursuing it.

source_sentence: 如是，賢護！
translation: So it is, Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 彼善男子、善女人端坐繫念，專心想彼阿彌陀如來、應供、等正覺如是相好、如是威儀、如是大眾、如是說法。
translation: That good man or good woman sits correctly and concentrates his mind on contemplating that Amitâbha Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One with such features, such mannerisms, such assemblies, and such teachings.

source_sentence: 如聞繫念，一心相續次第不亂，或經一日、或復一夜、如是或至七日七夜，
translation: Suppose someone hears and remembers with one mind, continuing in sequence without disturbance for a day or night, or so for seven days or nights.

source_sentence: 如先所聞具足念故，是人必覩阿彌陀如來、應供、等正覺也。
translation: Because they're fully mindful of what they've heard before, this person will surely see Amitâbha Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One.

source_sentence: 若於晝時不能見者，若於夜分或睡夢中阿彌陀佛必當現也。
translation: If he can't see it during the day, Amitâbha Buddha will surely appear in the night or in a dream at night.

source_sentence: 「復次，賢護！
translation: Furthermore, Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 譬如世間若男、若女，遠行他國，於睡夢中見本居家，時實不知為晝、為夜，
translation: It is as if a man or woman in the world, traveling far away from one land or another, were to see their hometown in a dream of sleep and did not really know whether it was day or night.

source_sentence: 而亦不知為內、為外。
translation: They don't know whether it's internal or external.

source_sentence: 是人爾時所有眼根，墻壁、石山終不能障，乃至幽冥、黑闇亦不為礙也。
translation: That person's eye faculty at that point is unobstructed by walls or rocky mountains, and even the darkness and darkness won't obstruct it.

source_sentence: 「賢護！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩心無障礙亦復如是，當正念時，於彼所有佛剎中間，凡是一切須彌山王，
translation: And so it is with the unobstructed mind of great enlightening beings: when they are correctly concentrated, all the buddha-fields in those buddha-lands are like the polar mountains.

source_sentence: 及鐵圍山、大鐵圍山，乃至自餘諸黑山等，不能與此眼根為障，而亦不能覆蔽此心。
translation: Mount Cakravāḍa and the great iron mountains, as well as the other black mountains that surround it, cannot act as obstacles to this divine eye or obscure it.

source_sentence: 然是人者，其實未得天眼能見彼佛、亦無天耳聞彼法音、復非神通往彼世界、又亦不於此世界沒生彼佛前，
translation: But those who have not really attained the divine eye will be able to see that buddha, hear the sound of his teaching with their divine ears, go there without supernormal powers, and do not arise in this world before that buddha.

source_sentence: 而實但在此世界中積念熏修、久觀明利故，終得覩彼阿彌陀如來、應、等正覺僧眾圍遶菩薩會中，
translation: But, indeed, it is only in this world that they can permeate and cultivate the minds of those who are devoted to enlightenment and contemplate their benefits over a long period of time.

source_sentence: 或見自身在彼聽法，聞已憶念、受持、修行；
translation: Or they may see themselves there, listening to the Teaching; having heard it, they remember it, retain it, and practice it.

source_sentence: 或時復得恭敬、禮拜、尊承供養彼阿彌陀如來、應、等正覺已。
translation: At some point, they'll also be honored, venerated, venerated, and honored as an offering to the Amitâbha Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Awakened One.

source_sentence: 是人然後起此三昧；
translation: That person then gives rise to this concentration.

source_sentence: 其出觀已，次第思惟，如所見聞為他廣說。
translation: After emerging from that contemplation, he reflects in order, explaining it as he sees and hears it for others.

source_sentence: 「復次，賢護！
translation: Furthermore, Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 如此摩伽陀國有三丈夫：其第一者聞毘耶離城有一婬女名須摩那、彼第二人聞有婬女名菴羅波離、彼第三人聞有婬女名蓮華色。
translation: Thus, there are three men in the country of Magadha: the first hears that there's a promiscuous woman named Sumeru in the city of Vaiśālī, the second hears that there's a promiscuous woman named Kaḷārapālī, and the third hears that there's a promiscuous woman named lotus-colored.

source_sentence: 彼既聞已，各設方便繫意懃求，無時暫廢。
translation: Having heard it, they each set up a method to fix their minds and long for it, not abandoning it momentarily.

source_sentence: 然彼三人實未曾覩如是諸女，直以遙聞即興欲心，專念不息。
translation: However, those three people really had never seen such women before. They simply heard from a distance that their minds were filled with desire and concentrated on them without stopping.

source_sentence: 後因夢已，在王舍城與彼女人共行欲事；
translation: Later, having had a dream in which she was in the city of Rājagṛha engaged in sexual intercourse with that woman.

source_sentence: 欲事既成，求心亦息，希望既滿遂便覺寤；
translation: When the object of desire is accomplished, the thought of seeking also ceases; and when the wish is fulfilled, it then feels anguish.

source_sentence: 寤已追念夢中所行，如所聞見、如所證知、如是憶念，來詣汝所、具為汝說者，
translation: “Furthermore, reverend Śāriputra, just as you have seen, heard, experienced, and remembered what you did in your dreams, I am coming to tell you the story.

source_sentence: 汝應為彼方便說法、隨順教化，令其得住不退轉地、究竟成就阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: You should skillfully teach them the Dharma and follow their teaching, so that they will abide in the stage of nonretrogression and ultimately attain anuttarii samyaksarrzbodhi.

source_sentence: 彼於當來必得成佛，號曰善覺如來、應供、等正覺、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊。
translation: In the future, he will surely become a buddha named Sunetra Tathāgata, Arhat, Completely Enlightened One, Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct, Well-gone, Knower of the World, Unsurpassed, Tamer of Humans, Teacher of Devas and Humans, Buddha, Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 如是，三人既得忍已，還復憶念往昔諸事了了分明也。
translation: Thus, after the three people had attained forbearance, they also recalled the events of the past and understood them clearly.

source_sentence: 「賢護！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 彼善男子、善女人等，若欲成就菩薩摩訶薩思惟一切諸佛現前三昧亦復如是，
translation: Good men and good women, if they want to accomplish the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s concentration of contemplation on all buddhas’ manifestations, it is exactly like this:

source_sentence: 其身常住此世界中，暫得聞彼阿彌陀如來、應供、等正覺名號，而能繫心相續思惟，
translation: That body always abides in this world, momentarily hearing the names of Amitâbha Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Enlightened One, they can fix their minds and continue to think:

source_sentence: 次第不亂，分明覩彼阿彌陀佛，是為菩薩思惟、具足成就諸佛現前三昧。
translation: This is the bodhisattva's contemplation and perfect accomplishment of the buddhas' manifest samādhi in order without confusion, clearly pointing to that Amitâbha Buddha.

source_sentence: 「因此三昧得見佛故，遂請問彼阿彌陀佛言：『世尊！
translation: Because of this samādhi's attainment of seeing the Buddha, he asked that Amitâbha Buddha, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 諸菩薩等成就何法而得生此佛剎中耶？』
translation: What teaching did bodhisattvas and so forth accomplish that allowed them to be born in this buddha-stage?'

source_sentence: 爾時，阿彌陀佛語是菩薩言：『若人發心求生此者，常當繫心正念相續阿彌陀佛，
translation: At that time, the Buddha Amitâbha said these words to the bodhisattva: If someone decides to be born in this world, they should always concentrate their mind and correctly think of the successive buddha-hood of the Buddha Amitâbha.

source_sentence: 便得生也；
translation: They will then be born.

source_sentence: 既得生已，世尊於是知彼心故亦即念彼，彼方得見佛、世尊耳。』
translation: After they've been born, the Bhagavān then knows their mind and therefore also thinks of them, and they'll be able to see the Buddha and the Bhagavān.'

source_sentence: 「賢護！
translation: Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 時彼阿彌陀如來、應、等正覺告彼人言：『諸善男子！
translation: The Amitâbha Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Awakened One then addressed those people, saying, 'Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝當正念、精懃修習、發廣大心，必生此也。』
translation: You must correctly contemplate, diligently cultivate, and give rise to a broad mind, and you'll surely be born here.'

source_sentence: 「賢護！
translation: Bhadrapāla!
